issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: webhdfs
components.description: WebHDFS: HTTP REST API for HDFS

fields.description: Token acquisition fails if a hftp or webhdfs filesystem is obtained with no port in the authority.  Building a token service requires a port, and the renewer needs the port.  The default port is not being used when there is no port in the uri.
fields.summary: hftp/webhdfs can't get tokens if authority has no port

comments.body: Uses the canonical uri instead of the uri.  Expanded test cases, a lot.

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12523519/HDFS-3308.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 2 new or modified test files.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/2309//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/2309//console

This message is automatically generated.
The changes look fairly simple Tests + getCanonicalUri instead of getUri, and adding in the ugi parameter for testing I assume.  +1 (non-binding).
+1 patch looks good.

Hi Aaron, good catch.  I think you are right that the patch won't work when default port is not used.

bq. Hi Aaron, good catch. I think you are right that the patch won't work when default port is not used.

Thanks, thought so. Since it looks like you've already committed this, feel free to fix it in a follow-up JIRA, if that's easier.

Ah, so it does. Looks good, then. Thanks for looking into it.
